result.execSummary:
The defendant Monte DeCarlos Pounds was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to count 2; with Huber for work privileges; with credit for 6 days served

Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00pm on 10-13-2022
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 6, 2023 @ 01:30pm, Br-29

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation.  Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges by the end of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Cash bail applied.
- Court set restitution at zero.

- NO CONTACT at the Agent's discretion, with victims SC, KC. MP, and SW.
- NO CORPORAL PUNISHMENT to ANY minor child.
- NO CONTACT with firearms or ammunition.

- Complete Parenting Classes.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.

- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Random alcohol testing.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to count 1; with Huber for work privileges

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Monte DeCarlos Pounds

records.addlTxt:
SPIN FOR BR. 29:
Defendant Monte DeCarlos Pounds in court.  Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in court for Monte DeCarlos Pounds.  Prosecuting attorney Katie Bakunowicz in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 240 DAYS in the House of Correction, with Huber for work privileges, consecutive to COUNT 2, with credit for 6 days served AS TO COUNT 1 ONLY. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 MONTHS.
*
AS TO COUNT 2:
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 240 DAYS in the House of Correction, with Huber for work privileges, consecutive to COUNT 1. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Complete Parenting Classes.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Random alcohol testing.
- No contact at the agent's discretion, with victims SC, KC, MP, and SW.
- No corporal punishment to ANY minor child.
- No contact with firearms or ammunition.
- Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation.

- Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges by the end of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Funds should first come from any bail on deposit, any bail remaining shall be returned to the person who posted it.  

- Court set restitution at zero.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 10/13/22.

Probation review hearing scheduled in Branch 29.
Review hearing scheduled for January 6, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Case set for a sentencing hearing. Branch 29 is in trial and unable to hear the matter. Case spun to Branch 37, Judge Dee. Parties notified.
on behalf of defendant, filed.

OFF THE RECORD- Defendant Monte DeCarlos Pounds in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Sentencing hearing. Court is in trial on another matter and unable to hear case. Case is adjourned for an additional Sentencing hearing to Br 29.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Anger Mgmt verification, filed.
Documentation of services for sentencing, filed.

Defendant Monte DeCarlos Pounds in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a plea and sentencing hearing.  State has filed an AMENDED information. Defense counsel acknowledges receipt, waives reading, and enters a temporary not guilty plea.  Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2: Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Due to the lateness of the hour, Case adjourned to Branch 29 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
letter from the parenting network, filed.
Certificate of participation, filed.
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights and Addendum, filed.
Jury Instructions, filed.

Defendant Monte DeCarlos Pounds in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  
Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
OFF THE RECORD.  Hearing held via Zoom.  Scheduling conference held.  Atty. Wineke requests a plea and sentencing date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Monte DeCarlos Pounds in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
filed.
signed and filed.

Defendant Monte DeCarlos Pounds in court.  Katherine Seelow for Mallory Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Annamarie Wineke, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning at the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing. Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KC, MP, SC, SW
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Monte DeCArlos Pounds in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/25/22 @ 1p
